objects.name: National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC)
objects.description: Primary author and publisher of the report; also authored the YARA rules included in the detection section.

objects.name: UMBRELLA STAND C2 IP
objects.description: Hardcoded default command-and-control IP used by UMBRELLA STAND. Malware beacons over fake TLS on port 443.

objects.name: Actor hidden directory
objects.description: Hidden directory used by UMBRELLA STAND components for storage and persistence; modified sysctl to hide this path.

objects.name: Shell result file template
objects.description: Temporary results file created by UMBRELLA STAND in its first shell implementation for exfiltration of command output.

objects.name: Chunk tracking INI template
objects.description: INI file used by UMBRELLA STAND to track chunk collection state in the second shell implementation.

objects.name: LD Preload configuration
objects.description: Used by malware to achieve persistence by loading libguic.so into new processes via ldpreload.

objects.name: libguic.so LD_PRELOAD component
objects.description: Actor shared object placed in hidden directory and loaded via ldpreload to subsequently load cisz.

objects.name: Impersonated process path
objects.description: Hardcoded fake executable name used by blghtd for process name spoofing to evade detection.

objects.name: Injected library (reboot_hooker suspected)
objects.description: Shared object string hardcoded in command-line for dskz to inject into PID 1 (init). Believed to be the reboot_hooker component.

objects.name: Injected library string variant
objects.description: String present in injected tooling related to library injection used by UMBRELLA STAND.

objects.name: BusyBox binary (renamed lidwok)
objects.description: Actor-deployed BusyBox binary renamed to lidwok and stored in the hidden .ztls directory for executing shell commands.

objects.name: Indicator for blghtd (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of UMBRELLA STAND networking binary responsible for C2 and tasking processing.

objects.name: Indicator for blghtd (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of UMBRELLA STAND networking binary responsible for C2 and tasking processing.

objects.name: Indicator for blghtd (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of UMBRELLA STAND networking binary responsible for C2 and tasking processing.

objects.name: Indicator for jvnlpe (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of UMBRELLA STAND watchdog binary that monitors and restarts blghtd.

objects.name: Indicator for jvnlpe (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of UMBRELLA STAND watchdog binary that monitors and restarts blghtd.

objects.name: Indicator for jvnlpe (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of UMBRELLA STAND watchdog binary that monitors and restarts blghtd.

objects.name: Indicator for cisz (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of UMBRELLA STAND component responsible for initialization, launching injection, and starting jvnlpe.

objects.name: Indicator for cisz (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of UMBRELLA STAND component responsible for initialization, launching injection, and starting jvnlpe.

objects.name: Indicator for cisz (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of UMBRELLA STAND component responsible for initialization, launching injection, and starting jvnlpe.

objects.name: Indicator for libguic.so (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of UMBRELLA STAND shared object loaded via ldpreload used to load cisz.

objects.name: Indicator for libguic.so (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of UMBRELLA STAND shared object loaded via ldpreload used to load cisz.

objects.name: Indicator for libguic.so (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of UMBRELLA STAND shared object loaded via ldpreload used to load cisz.

objects.name: Indicator for reboot_hooker (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the unknown UMBRELLA STAND component used to hook the device reboot function.

objects.name: Indicator for reboot_hooker (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the unknown UMBRELLA STAND component used to hook the device reboot function.

objects.name: Indicator for reboot_hooker (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the unknown UMBRELLA STAND component used to hook the device reboot function.

objects.name: Indicator for a (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of UMBRELLA STAND command-line tool used to AES encrypt and decrypt files on victim devices.

objects.name: Indicator for a (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of UMBRELLA STAND command-line tool used to AES encrypt and decrypt files on victim devices.

objects.name: Indicator for a (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of UMBRELLA STAND command-line tool used to AES encrypt and decrypt files on victim devices.

objects.name: Indicator for lidwok (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of BusyBox (renamed lidwok) deployed by actors to provide a shell environment and utilities.

objects.name: Indicator for lidwok (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of BusyBox (renamed lidwok) deployed by actors to provide a shell environment and utilities.

objects.name: Indicator for lidwok (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of BusyBox (renamed lidwok) deployed by actors to provide a shell environment and utilities.

objects.name: Indicator for dskz (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of actor tool used to inject shared objects into specified processes.

objects.name: Indicator for dskz (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of actor tool used to inject shared objects into specified processes.

objects.name: Indicator for dskz (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of actor tool used to inject shared objects into specified processes.

objects.name: Indicator for tdp (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of actor-deployed tcpdump (v4.99.1) used by the actors to perform packet captures on victim devices.

objects.name: Indicator for tdp (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of actor-deployed tcpdump (v4.99.1) used by the actors to perform packet captures on victim devices.

objects.name: Indicator for tdp (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of actor-deployed tcpdump (v4.99.1) used by the actors to perform packet captures on victim devices.

objects.name: Indicator for nbso (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of actor-deployed nbtscan (v1.0.35) used by the actors for NetBIOS name discovery.

objects.name: Indicator for nbso (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of actor-deployed nbtscan (v1.0.35) used by the actors for NetBIOS name discovery.

objects.name: Indicator for nbso (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of actor-deployed nbtscan (v1.0.35) used by the actors for NetBIOS name discovery.

objects.name: Fortinet
objects.description: Vendor of the targeted FortiGate 100D series firewalls referenced throughout the report.

objects.name: umbrella stand
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND is a medium-sophistication set of actor binaries deployed to embedded FortiGate 100D devices to facilitate long‑term access. It provides remote shell execution (two implementations), file reading and chunked exfiltration, configurable beacon frequency and C2 IP, and AES‑encrypted C2 communications that impersonate TLS on TCP/443. Components include blghtd (networking), jvnlpe (watchdog), cisz (initialisation and library injection), libguic.so (ldpreload loader), an unknown reboot_hooker (hooks device reboot), and 'a' (AES file encryptor). It uses process injection (via dskz), hides in /data2/.ztls/, spoofs its process name to /bin/httpsd, abuses FortiOS protection mechanisms to hide its directory, and may achieve persistence via ldpreload and reboot hooking. It was observed alongside public tools (BusyBox, nbtscan, tcpdump, openLDAP). Default C2 IP observed: 89.44.194.32.

objects.name: shoe rack
objects.description: A previously unknown piece of malware identified on the compromised FortiGate device. It is not directly linked in this report and its functionality is beyond scope; the report speculates it may have been used to deploy additional command-line utilities or to enable a file transfer service.

objects.name: coathanger
objects.description: Referenced as prior malware with notable similarity in loading components to UMBRELLA STAND. Several tools described in the COATHANGER report were present on the device, and the report notes that further hidden functionality may exist as described in COATHANGER reporting.

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_stack_constants_used_for_crypt
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_stack_constants_used_for_crypt
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
encrypted stack strings."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = {C6 45 D0 92 C6 45 D1 48 C6 45 D2 D6 C6 45 D3 E3 C6 45
D4 39 C6 45 D5 EE C6 45 D6 CE C6 45 D7 E4 C6 45 D8 59 C6 45 D9 58
C6 45 DA 97 C6 45 DB E5 C6 45 DC 2E C6 45 DD 27 C6 45 DE 98 C6 45
DF DE C6 45 E0 93 C6 45 E1 A8 C6 45 E2 77 C6 45 E3 9B C6 45 E4 4A
C6 45 E5 F0 C6 45 E6 EF C6 45 E7 74 C6 45 E8 80 C6 45 E9 2D C6 45
EA EB C6 45 EB 30 C6 45 EC 1F C6 45 ED B5 C6 45 EE D9 C6 45 EF C7}
// Key
        $ = {C6 45 C0 77 C6 45 C1 90 C6 45 C2 3D C6 45 C3 35 C6 45
C4 A4 C6 45 C5 9F C6 45 C6 0F C6 45 C7 5E C6 45 C8 F5 C6 45 C9 52
C6 45 CA 44 C6 45 CB 69 C6 45 CC B9 C6 45 CD C0 C6 45 CE BA C6 45
CF DC} // IV
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        any of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_plaintext_of_encrypted_stings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_plaintext_of_encrypted_stings
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
strings, if string obfuscation is not present."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = {ED B8 83 20}
        $ = "%s/%d.sv"
        $ = "%s/%s.ini"
        $ = "%s>%s 2>&1"
        $ = "%[^=]=%[^=]"
        $ = "/data2/.ztls/"
        $ = "/proc/%s/status"
        $ = "%*s %s"
        $ = "./lidwok killall blghtd"
        $ = "89.44.194.32"
        $ = "/data2/.ztls/lidwok"
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        5 of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_injected_tool_load_mechanism
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_injected_tool_load_mechanism
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
strings present in tooling."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = "LoadMsg"
        $ = "/bin/httpsd"
        $ = "/proc/%d/cmdline"
        $ = "/tmp/logx"
        $ = "error"
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        all of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_deobfuscated_custom_base64_and_encryption_key
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_deobfuscated_custom_base64_and_encryption_key
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
custom base64 alphabet and encryption key reference."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:

        $ = ",((@=+utivp45ztvo6&RFvt&*^tp&!q;"
        $ =
"ef345FGHIJKLMNOPWghijklmnoXYd67TUVABC89+/pqrstQRSDEZabcuvwxyz012"

    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        any of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_strings_used_in_firewall_malware
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_strings_used_in_firewall_malware
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
strings."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = "/bin/httpsd"
        $ = "dxumbsu"
        $ = "/proc/%d/cmdline"
        $ = "/tmp/logx"
        $ = "/etc/ld.so.preload"
        $ = "loadMsg"
        $ ="/SYSV64564856"
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        all of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_injection_related_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_injection_related_strings
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
strings used to configure injection."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = "/SYSV64564856"
        $ = "/etc/ld.so.preload"
        $ = "version 2"
        $ = "init_drivercheck"
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        3 of them
}

objects.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND contains functionality to receive and run Shell commands.

objects.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND contains AES-encrypted strings.

objects.name: Process Injection
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND uses tooling to perform process injection.

objects.name: Indicator Removal: File Deletion
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND binaries had been deleted from the device.

objects.name: Hide Artifacts: Process Argument Spoofing
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND modifies it’s process name

objects.name: Hide Artifacts: Hidden Files and Directories
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND and associated tooling use hidden directories.

objects.name: Boot or Logon Autostart Execution: Kernel Modules and Extensions
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND has functionality to modify reboot to achieve persistence.

objects.name: Hijack Execution Flow: Dynamic Linker Hijacking
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND has functionality to load via ldpreload.

objects.name: Process Discovery
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND performs process discovery to check that its main process is still executing.

objects.name: Network Service Discovery
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND was in use with nbtscan which can list NetBIOS computer names.

objects.name: Network Sniffing
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND was in use with tcpdump which can be, and was, used to perform packet captures.

objects.name: Data Obfuscation: Protocol or Service Impersonation
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND uses fake TLS for communications with the C2 server.

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Umbrella Stand
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. umbrella stand.
